RelatedSentence: The International child welfare agency UNICEF is warning that hundreds of thousands of children in South Sudan are at imminent risk of disease and death .

On the eve of a humanitarian pledging conference in Norway , UNICEF said on Sunday that 80 percent of the children under the age of five in South Sudan 's three worst conflict - affected states - Jonglei , Upper Nile and Unity - are in grave danger .
It said nearly 50,000 children across the country could die of malnutrition , and that nearly 740,000 are at high risk of food insecurity .
United Nations Secretary - General Ban Ki - moon has said that by the end of this year , half of South Sudan 's 12 million people will be either in flight , facing starvation or dead .
UNICEF is seeking $ 111 million to deal with the crisis facing women and children in South Sudan this year .
